i1.name: Echoing Flames
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Urgot's''' six legs each conceal a shotgun that covers an arc, together forming a full circle of cover around him. Each shotgun has one shell and an individual reload timer.

The next basic attack {{tip|on-hit}} in the direction and range of a ''loaded'' shotgun causes it to fire, instantly dealing {{as|{{pp|6|key=%|40 to 100|1;6;9;11;13;15}} AD}} {{as|(+ {{pp|5|changedisplay=true|key=%|2 to 6|1;6;9;11;13}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemies in a cone, up to {{pp|60 to 360}} against {{tip|monster|monsters}}.
i1.notes:
* ''Echoing Flames'':
** Will not trigger while {{tip|Blind|blinded}} or if the basic attack is blocked by {{cai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}}.
*** It bypasses {{ai|Spirit's Refuge|Shen|blocking}} and {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodging}} effects.
** Will not trigger versus {{tip|ward|wards}}.
** Will trigger from {{iis|Runaan's Hurricane}} additional bolts.
** Will not apply {{sti|life steal|link=true}}, but does apply on {{sti|spell vamp|link=true}} at 33% effectiveness.
** Will apply [[spell effect]]s.
** When basic attacking certain units (e.g {{cai|Jack in the Box|Shaco}}), ''Echoing Flames'' does not trigger, however it will trigger when attacking them with {{ai|Purge|Urgot}}.
* '''Urgot's''' legs never change in orientation, with his body instead rotating on top of them; the leg that faces northeast will always face northeast. This does not affect '''Urgot's''' facing direction for the purposes of abilities such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}.

q1.name: Corrosive Charge
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Urgot''' launches a canister at the target location that explodes {{fd|0.3}} seconds after it lands, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} all enemies hit for {{fd|1.25}} seconds.
q1.notes: * ''Corrosive Charge'' prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|0.3}} seconds.

w1.name: Purge
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Urgot's''' other abilities apply {{as|Purge|buzzword2}} to enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be marked at a time.

{{sbc|Active:}} For 4 seconds, '''Urgot''' grants {{tip|ghosting}} to non-champions and non-epic monsters around him, gains 40% {{tip|slow resist}} and autonomously [[basic attack]]s the nearest enemy at a '''fixed''' {{sti|attack speed|{{as|{{fd|3.0}} attack speed}}}}, prioritizing enemy {{tip|champions}} marked with {{as|Purge|buzzword2}}, refreshing it with every attack. '''Urgot''' can keep attacking without interfering with his movement, but while firing his {{as|'''base''' movement speed}} is reduced by 125. ''Purge'' can be recast after {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
Attacks deal modified damage, down to a minimum of 50 damage against {{tip|minions}}, with only 50% {{tip|on-hit}} damage and cannot {{tip|critically strike}}.
At maximum rank, ''Purge'' lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.
w1.notes:
*The initial cast and the manual recast count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{nie|Spellblade}}, charging {{ii|Spellbinder}}, and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**Before maximum rank, if ''Purge'' is not manually recasted, the effect will end without being considered as an ability activation.
* Before maximum rank, if continuously attacking without being interrupted or interrupting or canceling the cast, '''Urgot''' will shoot 13 attacks.
* The bolts are considered basic attacks and thus apply {{sti|life steal|link=true}} at full efficiency.
* '''Urgot's''' attack commands during ''Purge'' instead issue movement commands.
* {{tip|Slow resist}} cannot modify flat reductions in movement speed.
* Percentage {{tip|slow|slows}} apply after the flat movement reduction.
* '''Urgot''' will not attack while affected by [[Crowd_control#Loss_of_Control|hard crowd control]] or {{tip|disarm}}.
* ''Purge'' will apply {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} on every shot at 100% of the listed damage.
** {{tip|On-hit}} effects applied by the bolts will deal 50% damage regardless.

e1.name: Disdain
description: '''Urgot''' {{tip|dash|dashes}} in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in the way and {{tip|airborne|knocking them aside}}. Colliding with static terrain ends the dash.

'''Urgot''' comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion, {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|1.5}} seconds and, after a brief delay, also {{tip|airborne|flinging}} them to the location {{tt|100 units behind him|this destination is a fixed location and is unaffected by size modifiers on Urgot or the target moving away before the displacement started}} over {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
e1.notes:
* '''Urgot''' turns around when tossing an enemy over him, always facing his victim.
* ''Disdain'' prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
* The range indicator length is 475 units, but the dash only moves '''Urgot''' 450 units.
* {{si|Flash}} can be used during the cast time and ''Disdain'' will be performed from the new location.

effects.str: • Shield Strength: (+ 150% bonus AD) (+ 15% bonus health)

r1.name: Fear Beyond Death
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Urgot''' fires a chem-drill forward that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing {{as|physical damage}} and leashing them for 4 seconds, during which they're {{tip|sight|revealed}} and {{tip|slow|slowed}} by {{as|{{pp|type=target's '''missing''' health|11|key=%|0 to 75|key1=%|0 to 75|formula=1% per 1% missing health. ''This is capped at 75%''}}|health}}.

''Fear Beyond Death'' can be reactivated if the target is below {{as|{{sti|health|25% of their '''maximum''' health}}}}, and automatically does so if the target is killed by the damage from the projectile, if the ability is recasted while the target was above the threshold and is then brought within it, or if the target is within the threshold at the end of its duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Urgot''' begins channeling as he launches chains at the target, {{tip|suppression|suppressing}} them and pushing them up to {{tt|1000|Estimated}} units away, after which they're reeled in over {{fd|1.5}} seconds, during which they are {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|invulnerable}} to damage from other sources.
If the channel is successful, the target is [[kill#execute|executed]] and surrounding enemies in a 600 unit radius are {{tip|flee|feared}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 75%.
r1.notes:
* The circular execution indicator is visible to '''Urgot''' only and appears on all enemy champions below the threshold.
* The recast's name is ''Mercy''.
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} on first cast and {{tip|raw damage}} on recast.
* The initial cast always counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{nie|Spellblade}}, charging {{ii|Spellbinder}}, and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
** If the ability hits a target who is below the threshold, it will automatically recast itself and it won't be considered as an ability activation.
** If the ability hits a target who is above the threshold and it's recasted early, the recast will happen automatically when they reach the threshold and it won't be considered as as ability activation.
** If the target got hit while above the threshold and it is recasted after they fall below it, the recast will be considered as an ability activation.
* '''Urgot''' can move while channeling and while executing his target.
* Reactivating the ability early will reel the target as soon as they reach the {{as|25% '''maximum''' health}} threshold.
** The ability will reactivate and execute regardless of '''Urgot''' being affected by {{tip|crowd control}} or not, including self or enemy-imposed {{tip|stasis}}.
* The recast cannot be used while the target is {{tip|untargetable}}.
* The recast's chains are classified as a {{tip|projectile}} and can be stopped if:
** '''Urgot''' {{tip|death|dies}}.
** The target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}.
** The target is {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immune}}.
* {{tip|spell shield|Spell shields}} will '''not''' block the chains.
* {{tip|Cleanse|Cleansing}} the {{tip|suppression}} during the reel in will prevent the forced movement from being renewed, but will still have the most recent one present and move the victim to '''Urgot's''' previous location.
* {{tip|unstoppable|Unstoppability}}, while preventing being dragged, does not remove the {{tip|suppression}}, which can last for longer than the usual execution time. Once the target inevitably loses their ''unstoppability'', they are executed within {{fd|1.5}} seconds. The target is ''untargetable'' for the whole duration of the ''suppression'', even while ''unstoppable''.
* When the chains start reeling in and suppressing a player's champion, chains will also cover the sides of their screen.
* The target will die regardless of their {{as|'''current''' health}} once the recast's chains hit, even if they are {{tip|heal|healed}}.
** If the target has {{tip|invulnerability}} that persists the duration of the channel, it will protect them from the execution.
*** {{ai|Undying Rage|Tryndamere}} will prevent {{ci|Tryndamere}} from dying by the execute. The execute will bypass his minimum health threshold though and reduce him to {{as|1 health}} in this case.
*** The effect will also not prevent the activation of {{tip|resurrection}} effects, such as {{ii|Guardian Angel}} or {{cai|Rebirth|Anivia}}.
*** [[Death#Post-death_events|Post-death events]] such as {{tip|zombie state|Zombie State}} effects (e.g, {{cai|Death Defied|Karthus}}, {{cai|Icathian Surprise|Kog'Maw}}, and {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}) will be triggered.
*** Only the target's {{as|'''current''' health}} will count as '''Urgot's''' damage in post-game statistics and {{sti|spell vamp|link=true}} healing.
